abstract: Monsanto files lawsuit against California Office of Environmental Health Hazard Assessment and its acting director Lauren Zeise; manufacturer of herbicide Roundup, which produces billions in revenue, seeks to prevent agency from adding glyphosate, weed-killer’s primary ingredient, to state’s register of known carcinogens.
lead_paragraph: Monsanto stepped up its defense of Roundup, a widely used weed killer, by filing a lawsuit in California seeking to prevent glyphosate from being added to the state’s list of known carcinogens.

headline.main: Monsanto Sues California Over Herbicide Classification
headline.print_headline: Monsanto Sues California Over Herbicide Classification

snippet: Monsanto stepped up its defense of Roundup, a widely used weed killer, by filing a lawsuit in California seeking to prevent glyphosate from being added to the state’s list of known carcinogens.
